title: AU Deals: Super Early Boxing Day Game Savings, Winter Sale Deep Discounts, and More!
description: Santa arrives early with a bunch of gaming sales events that cannot be missed!
author: Adam Mathew
byline: The Best Gaming Deals In Australia
excerpt: Santa arrives early with a bunch of gaming sales events that cannot be missed!
text: Fill up that Santa sack with last minute bargains.Time groweth short if you're not planning on not being a Grinch this holiday season. Bargain-priced presents (which I suspect are early Boxing Day deals leaked early) can still be yours, particularly if you have the Super Fast Delivery perk unlocked via an Amazon Prime membership. I'll still be on board over these holiday periods because I'm right there with your mentalityâ€”I cannot resist discounts and kick myself if I've missed them. In retro news, I'm celebrating the Aussie birthday of a rare and expensive bird, the SNK Neo Geo CD. Released in limited numbers in Oz around the $600 ballpark ($1,299 in '24 bux), this bad boy delivered near-perfect arcade-quality games, though it was a "budget" alternative to the hilari-expensive, cartridge-based Neo Geo AES. Being CD-based marred this unit with lonnng load times, though the gruelling wait for Metal Slug, Samurai Shodown, and Fatal Fury was always worth it. Here's a shot of the beast I sold a kidney and a lung for. Laser: still going strong. html:
Fill up that Santa sack with last minute bargains.

Time groweth short if you're not planning on not being a Grinch this holiday season. Bargain-priced presents (which I suspect are early Boxing Day deals leaked early) can still be yours, particularly if you have the Super Fast Delivery perk unlocked via an Amazon Prime membership. I'll still be on board over these holiday periods because I'm right there with your mentalityâ€”I cannot resist discounts and kick myself if I've missed them.

In retro news, I'm celebrating the Aussie birthday of a rare and expensive bird, the SNK Neo Geo CD. Released in limited numbers in Oz around the $600 ballpark ($1,299 in '24 bux), this bad boy delivered near-perfect arcade-quality games, though it was a "budget" alternative to the hilari-expensive, cartridge-based Neo Geo AES. Being CD-based marred this unit with lonnng load times, though the gruelling wait for Metal Slug, Samurai Shodown, and Fatal Fury was always worth it. Here's a shot of the beast I sold a kidney and a lung for. Laser: still going strong.

This Day in Gaming ðŸŽ‚

Aussie birthdays for notable games.

- Neo Geo CD launch, 1994. eBay

- Kirby & the Amazing Mirror (GBA) 2004. eBay

- WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2007 (PSP) 2006. eBay

- Harvest Moon DS: Sunshine Islands (DS) 2010. eBay

Introduces some interesting new features, particularly the fast-paced and compelling Rush mode, but much of the package beyond that feels overly familiar.

Exciting Bargains for Xbox

Tekken 8

Interesting tweaks to Tekkenâ€™s classic fighting systems, a full suite of fun offline modes, great new characters, incredible training tools, and a vastly improved online experience all add up to a fighting game. 9/10, amazing.

LEGO Advent Calendar Face Off 2024

This holiday season, I'm doing something different with the LEGO section. In Mathew Manor, my sons and I are racing LEGO Advent Calendarsâ€”we open our respective ones daily and compare the mini-prizes for "Coolness" and "Actual Xmas-ness". Winner gets extra eggnog.

If you're also feeling festive, here are the cheapest prices for the three calendars we're using. Or just live vicariously through us.

  • LEGO Star Wars Advent 2024 - A$59.95 $45
  • LEGO Spider-Man Advent 2024 - A$59.95 $45
  • LEGO City Advent 2024 - A$59.95 $45

Back to top

Adam Mathew is our Aussie deals wrangler. He plays practically everything, often on YouTube.
